results.title: Basketball techniques for girls
results.brief_description: This film gives a clear demonstration and explanation of basic skills: Basic movement skills; running, starting, stopping, turning, passing, finger control, movement with the pass, leading the receiver, choice of right pass, shooting, finger control, arm extension wrist flip, choice of the right shot, dribbling, faking and pivoting. No other credits available.

No other credits available.

No other credits available.

results.title: Basketball strategy for girls
results.creator_credit: Educational Productions and Young America Films
results.brief_description: The use of planned strategic play on the basketball court. Demonstrates offensive moves such as fakes, rolls, cuts, variances of pace, the figure eight and defence strategies such as player to player and basic zone, shifting zone, triangle, and diagonal defences.

results.title: Basil's adventure
results.brief_description: An interactive 2-d animation based on a small boy called Basil. Using interactive elements and characters, you can help Basil to find his way home. The 7 minute animation was aimed at the young, but all ages should enjoy it. Very entertaining and quite amusing.

group.title: Top Screen 2007 VCE Media Interactive Works

results.title: Bunyip
results.brief_description: Short Flash animation based around a bunyip, an Aboriginal mythical animal, that goes on a journey into town and encounters a drunken man called Larry. Intrigued by Larry, the bunyip sets out on a quest to eat him but has to face several ordeals before finally reaching the drunken Larry.

results.title: Tank wars
results.brief_description: Command your tank around the battlefield to destroy all other tanks. Four levels, working on a scoring system. Objective is to kill all enemies in the least amount of time.

results.title: Snake bite
results.brief_description: An interactive war game set in Iraq. You are a soldier and your mission is to intercept a rebel force planning an attack on Al Hilhah, south of Baghdad, and destroy this terrorist threat before they are able to kill any of the city’s civilians.

group.title: Top Screen 2007 VCE Media Interactive Works

results.title: Basics of direct instruction
results.brief_description: Gives an overview of the Direct Instruction technique which was developed in the 1960’s to develop successful students with a positive approach and works on problem solving skills so students learn to learn. Skills are broken into sub-skills until mastered and integrated. Notes the goals, assumptions and characteristics of Direct Instruction programmes, provides a brief description of teaching techniques and how to prepare a Direct Instruction program.
